Author: Llama#1330
Content: I know that Equaliser is working on getting rewards out

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Who is coding those contracts?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Cryptoon Rewards CC is one of the initial CC consensus modules (aka CC contracts) on Komodo platform developed by @jl777c

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Actually all current working modules are developed by JL except of ChannelsCC which is a brilliant job of @Mihailo

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Ahaa, was more asking who is editing the cc's for them

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: I assume it's not just plug and play and you still need a dev to code them?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: It depends of your needs - if current one is suits your needs you can just activate it on your asset chain and use it by RPC calls

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: If you need some conceptual/consensus customisation - in this case source code rework needed

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: In general as a dAPP developer you can use CC module just as a magic box (you have  human readable RPC calls with predicted and expected outputs and may dont care mostly what going on on vins/vouts level)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Not sure tbh what Equaliser do â˜º

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: the latter I think

Author: Cryptoon#3362

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Hush plans to enable the rewards CC, please let me know if there are any consensus changes coming soon

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @dukeleto how would you fund rewards plans?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I think rewards is solid, but I imagine any significant bugs that would be found would be hard forks. Hate to sound like a shill, but probably worth while to wait and run some incentivized tests with it on LABS. Either that or do some thorough testing of it yourself

Author: Alright#0419
Content: have you considered using two fungible momom chains?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: one that will hard fork as often as needed, one that will rarely hardfork

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: given the above, maybe Rewards is just a nice-to-have for Hush, it's not our focus. haven't thought of multiple chains, the main reason Hush is becoming an AC is for sapling, so if any CC stuff makes it harder/more work, it will be left for a future upgrade

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Found a pretty bad bug with rewards

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Im not sure why its been done, but the recover funds is not working at all... if for any reason imputs are not found, and this could be for many reasons... Then its just returning the locked funds

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It needs to actaully check all teh conditions are met before releasing this recover thing... IMO recover shouldnt be there... doesnt seem like it was designed to have it. Doesnt seem any simple fix.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Seems rewards would need a major redesign to fix this problem.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what do you mean? which tx, which case

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: at any time it cannot find inputs it just does the recover transaction. This means its skipping minseconds checks and many other things

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I cant fix the validation properly...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: because the RPC is wrong

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what is the recover transaction?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you mean unlock?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I dont really understand why it is there

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: please be more specific and dont jump to conclusions

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it seems that if there are not enogh inputs to pay the reward, weather that be becasuse not locked long enough ... or they actually are not there  it will just send a recover tx.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what line of code?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it needs to at the very least make sure the minimum requirments are met before sending this tx, but the checks for these requirments are deeper inisde other  loops with no easy way of returning an error to stop this tx being sent

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it is rpc level, so even if the code is changed, anybody could issue the same tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: which is why I dont understand why there is a secondary validation for this... its skipping all teh requirement checks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it needs to check all these first ... then bail out

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not bail before its checked them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is just not adding the reward as a "better to recover the funds, than nothing at all"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what line of code is skipping the validation?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its not one line of code

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its the whole thing

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: lol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the fix i suggested was for the case where there are no rewards, that the destination address needs to sign a vin

Author: blackjok3r#3181
jl777c#5810
Content: that way, some random third party cant close out existing rewards

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think it just needs to not be there ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: doesnt make a lot of sense

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the rewards calc is done above

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the reward was more than txfee, then and only then does it try this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the rewards inputs are not therem then the rewards fund is depleted and it is reasonable to just recover the funds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so in the recover case, add a normal vin and have the validation make sure the destination pubkey has a vin, not sure why you are freaking out over this

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no but it wont find any inputs if minseconds hasnt passed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so then it sends the funds out.... when they are not allwoed to be released

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Does that make sense?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the rewards calc would be 0

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it wouldnt go into that if statement

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but the validation isnt checking it... I thaught this was what Alright was going on about how he was able to steal funds...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, we need to add validation

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: both need to check the same thing... this recover tx isnt right

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: make sure minseconds has passed and add a destpubkey vin to the recover tx and make sure that is there

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how is this impossible to fix??

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: maybe it is not, but I couldnt see any simple way.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and where is it bypassing all the checks, in the validation 'U' case it sure seems to go through all the validation steps

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: line 277 returns true before everything is checked

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so add check for minseconds and vin signed by destination pubkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: wouldnt that work>

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if minseconds has passed and the receiver is willing to recover funds without rewards, let them

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: maybe, if I can work out hwo to do that ... it seems those checks are inside rewards calc ... but there is no reward in this tx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just move the reward = RewardsCalc(amount,tx.vin[0].prevout.hash,APR,minseconds,maxseconds,mindeposit) to above the recover if statement

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why wont that work?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that would work?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: amount is the principal amount in vout[0], isnt it?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: RewardsCalc only needs that to calculate reward, right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you dont even need to know the reward, you just need to know minseconds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which is part of the plan, which is known

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: confused by your confusion

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes ... but what is minseconds calcuated from, CCduration of each vin I guess?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: minseconds is baked into the rewards plan on plan creation? at least that is what i remember, but it was a long time ago i wrote it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I mean what I need to compare minseconds to

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: minseconds is already set!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: minseconds is there yes ... but what is it that compares to...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: elapsed time is returned by CCduration()

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: against what tx?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each vin?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes and if the youngest vin is old enough, then it is fine

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all vins must be minseconds old

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there also needs to be a normal vin signed by the destination, this fixes alrights "dos" attack

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and recover is needed, even if it is nearly impossible to implement

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes I understand that part, you dont want any one releaseing funds without rewards apart from the person who locked them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: otherwise, if the plan funds every run out, all funds get locked

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and even, the point of view that if you want to unlock all your coins without any reward, maybe it is possible at anytime

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the minseconds check is impossible to do

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I guess if you just want them back with no reward and nobody else can do it it may be ok to just ignore minseconds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i can go either way on it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Do we know if the globabl txfee fix works yet ? I assume its ok, but had no way to test it
